@sk8rdude461 wrote:

suseto:

Would I need to create a class for player owned shops or could I simply introduce it within trade.java server side?

Would depend on the code of your server.
You probably can/will implement it in the same class, but sometimes itâ€™s better to place it in a separate class.

item.title: Player Owned Shops 667 revision
item.dc:creator: @Soulxs Soulxs
item.description:
@Soulxs wrote:

You need to work both client and server sided, given the fact that an interface is used.
You can make this interface in RSInterface.java, then send data to that interface server sided.

Read full topic

item.title: Player Owned Shops 667 revision
item.dc:creator: @suseto suseto
item.description:
@suseto wrote:

I was wondering if introducing this required just source or both source and client involvement as an interface is required. Within player.java I know there is a line similiar to this giving the option to trade and or to

[code]public void sendDefaultPlayersOptions() {

	getPackets().sendPlayerOption("Follow", 2, false);
	getPackets().sendPlayerOption("Trade with", 3, false);
}

[/code]

So I wondered if adding this

To the line above option 2 would be where to start and if so what other instance or files would be required to edit or add in snippets?

Read full topic
